content: lorraine s baby singlet with crossover neck seamed or seamless you choose yarn 50g 2 or 3 ply lace weight or 75g 4 ply fingering approx 250m needles anything from 3 5mm to 4 5mm bigger sizes make a loose drapey garment seamed version straight needles seamless version straight needles or 60cm/24 circular for yoke 40cm circular for the body or whatever you prefer for working in the round eg dpns 2 circulars magic loop size 2 or 3 ply will fit preemie or newborn 4 ply will fit newborn and will stretch to fit for several months i have seen photos of a 12 month baby in his as the baby gets wider the singlet gets shorter gauge varies according to your yarn and needle choices so not specified baby singlet - a lorraine major creation baby size 50g 3 ply wool needles 4 5mm a spare double pointed needle same size or smaller for joining crossover neck sts measurements body of singlet grows with baby unstretched 27 cm around stretched 50 cm around m1 = increase make a backwards loop over your left thumb and place on the needle yo = yarn over bring wool forward before knitting next st to create a hole note this singlet is worked by starting at the lower back working in rib up to the armhole level changing to garter st for the yoke dividing sts and creating a crossover neck then rejoining the sts and working in rib down to the lower front the crossover neck provides a good-sized opening for the baby s head without needing any ties please ensure all casting on and off is done loosely start at lower back end at lower front cast on 55 sts work in mistake st rib for 24 cm or longer if desired mistake st rib each row *k2 p2* repeat to last 3 sts k3 change to garter st and work 18 ridges 36 row mistake st rib divide for neck row 1 knit 17 cast off 21 very loosely knit 17 row 2 knit 17 turn and work on these sts for left side of front row 3 k1 m1 k to end garter st with row 4 knit crossover neck repeat row 3 & 4 until 18 sts have been increased 35 sts leave these stitches while you do the other side rejoin wool at inner edge of other 17 sts knit to end mistake st rib row 3 knit to last st m1 k1 row 4 knit repeat these two row until 35 sts join two pieces with crossover neck start at lower back knit 20 move next 15 sts to spare needle and place on top of sts of other needle join crossover by knitting together one st from each needle until all sts on spare needle are worked off knit remaining 20 sts work in mistake st rib until rib portion is same length as back cast off loosely in rib pattern sew side seams
